bibl.title: Letter from John A. Owen, Jr., to Philip Showalter Hench, October 10, 1947

div1.p: Owen details the arrangements for Hench's speech at the University of Virginia Alpha Omega Alpha society.

div1.head: Letter from John A. Owen, Jr., to Philip Showalter Hench, October 10, 1947
div1.opener:
UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA
DEPARTMENT OF MEDICINE
UNIVERSITY STATION
CHARLOTTESVILLE VIRGINIA
October 10, 1947.
DEPARTMENT OF INTERNAL MEDICINE
UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA HOSPITAL
Dr. Philip S. Hench,
Mayo Clinic,
Rochester, Minn.
Dear Dr. Hench,
div1.p:
I enjoyed very much our telephone conversation last week, and am hoping,
as are all our members, that will see your way clear to present the address
at our initiation ceremonies next month. We would be very much honored by
your presence, and the subject, Dr. Walter Reed, would undoubtedly attract
a large and enthusiastic audience.

As regards the transportation problem, I can give you the following de-
tails. First, the direct route from Lexington, Kentucky, to New York is
through Charlottesville as Dr. Blackford suggested. The C. & O. schedule is
as follows:
Leave LexingtonArrive CharlottesvilleLeave CharlottesvilleArrive N.Y.
..........1:05 A.M.9:25 A.M.
4:30 P.M.5:30 A.M.5:40 A.M.12:45 P.M.
8:42 P.M.9:55 A.M.10:05 A.M.4:45 P.M.
While this is not too satisfactory, I imagine it would be most convenient to
you to leave Lexington on the 8:42 Sunday, spend Monday here, give your address
in the afternoon, attend the banquet that night, and leave on the 1:05 train
arriving in New York 9:25 Tuesday morning. Any arrangement which best suits
your plans, however, will be quite satisfactory to us.

I sincerely hope you will be able to be with us next month and I should
like to place the resources of the chapter at your disposal; we should be
most happy to help you by arranging Pullman reservations, securing lantern
slide projectors and display tables for your talk, and doing anything else
which would help make your stay here a pleasant one.
I should like to hear of your further decisions on this matter.

closer.signed:
John A. Owen, Jr.,
President, Virginia Alpha Chapter,
Alpha Omega Alpha
